title: What to give a Type-Lover this Christmas
content:
Submitted by [dan\_reynolds](http://web.archive.org/web/20070808134229/http:/typophile.com/user/1085 "View user profile.") : 9.Dec.2005 12.20am 

**Linotype’s LinoLetter for December 2005 – What to give a Type-Lover this Christmas**

Check out the full version of this month’s newsletter at the Linotype website: [http://www.linotype.com/8-38-8-19120/issue200512.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20070808134229/http:/www.linotype.com/8-38-8-19120/issue200512.html "http://www.linotype.com/8-38-8-19120/issue200512.html").

_Content Preview:_ Giving gifts is easy and fun! Presenting a special edition of our newsletter, just in time for Christmas. Inside this month’s issue, you’ll find a list of fonts, t-shirts, and other design-oriented gems that are sure to fit under any Christmas tree. Additionally, this is the season to get acquainted with two typographic treats: the all-new Palatino nova, a long awaited 21st Century version of Prof. Hermann Zapf’s Palatino, and Candice, a “groovy” font in the party style of the 70s.

_Just Completed:_ The Linotype OpenType Library! Equip yourself and your computer with over 2500 top-of-the-line OpenType fonts, and be prepared for any design task the  
future holds.

[Read the rest of the Linoletter at Linotype.com!](http://web.archive.org/web/20070808134229/http:/www.linotype.com/8-38-8-19120/issue200512.html)

Or, [subscribe to the Linoletter](http://web.archive.org/web/20070808134229/http:/www.linotype.com/webshop/newsletter.php), and get the information delivered every month directly to your mailbox.
